structure.unit: STATE LIBRARIES -- LIBRARIANS -- STATE ARCHIVES AND RECORDS

law.catch_line: Duties as to information concerning Kentucky family cemeteries and as to gravesites of historically significant people -- Administrative regulations.
law.text:
In addition to the responsibilities set forth in KRS 171.311, the Kentucky Historical Society shall:
Collect, maintain, preserve, categorize, and cause to be published necessary information concerning Kentucky family cemeteries;
Undertake a systematic program which will restore and maintain the gravesites of any of the following historically significant people who are buried within this Commonwealth:
Past Governors of the Commonwealth and their spouses;
The three (3) former Vice Presidents of the United States from the Commonwealth: Richard M. Johnson; John C. Breckinridge; and Alben W. Barkley; and
The "First Pioneers," who were the original members in the first settlements at either Boonesboro, Harrodsburg, or Stanford in 1774-1775; and
Promulgate administrative regulations necessary to carry out the purposes of this section.
law.history: Amended 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 78, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1998. -- Amended 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 156, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1996. -- Created 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 198, sec. 1.
